CMultiXAlertableObject Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for CMultiXAlertableObject:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Any class that needs to set timer and be notified on its expiration, must be derived from CMultiXAlertableObject. This class enables setting timers and enables the callback function when the timer expires. A class that is derived from this class, must implement the pure virtual function OnTimer().


Public Member Functions

virtual void OnTimer (CMultiXTimer *Timer)=0
 Pure virtual function that me be implemented in the derived class.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void CMultiXAlertableObject::OnTimer ( CMultiXTimer *  Timer  )  [pure virtual]

Pure virtual function that me be implemented in the derived class.

This function is called when a timer, previously set using CMultiXApp::SetMultiXTimer(), expires. MultiX passes a pointer to the CMultiXTimer object passed to CMultiXApp::SetMultiXTimer().

Parameters:
Timer The pointer to the CMultiXTimer object.

Implemented in CMultiXSession.

CMultiXAlertableObjectID& CMultiXAlertableObject::AlertableID (  )  [inline]

The object ID used when creating a CMultiXTimer.

Since objects can be derived from multiple classes that have the ID() member functions, this function is provided to help in distiguishing between the different ID's and the alertable object ID.
